title: A Diffeomorphic Variable-Step Finite Difference Method
abstract:
This work introduces an approach to variable-step Finite Difference Method
(FDM) where non-uniform meshes are generated via a weight function, which
establishes a diffeomorphism between uniformly spaced computational coordinates
and variably spaced physical coordinates. We then derive finite difference
approximations for derivatives on variable meshes in both one-dimensional and
multi-dimensional cases, and discuss constraints on the weight function. To
demonstrate efficacy, we apply the method to the two-dimensional
time-independent Schr\"odinger equation for a harmonic oscillator, achieving
improved eigenfunction resolution without increased computational cost.
